Replies.Author: steve
Replies.Content:
Upon discussing Shinryaku! Ika musume with friends who had seen it, I received a

TROLLFAYES.JAYPEG

at which point the show made sense to me.

The best way I’ve heard to describe PSG is Powerpuff Girls meets DeadLeaves. If you haven’t seen DeadLeaves go watch it; same themes as the first few episodes of PSG, but with more action.

I was hoping to get 俺の妹がこんなに可愛いわけがない (Ore no Imouto ga Konnani Kawaii Wake ga nai… <3 Gene) out of the hat, but oh well. I'm excited for next semester when we get to watch all of the GOOD shows from the fall.

I'm also looking forward to the next two weeks with ZOMBEHS this coming week and horror animes (including my favorite) the week after.

Replies.Author: Grant Walker
Replies.Content:
I think I might have to check out DeadLeaves, then. I’ve never heard of it, but it can’t be too bad if it’s got a lot like Panty and Stocking.

And yeah, haha. That’s the show I was most interested in, too, even though I haven’t seen any bit of it yet. I guess I just like the concept too much.

I’m also looking forward to the next couple weeks. From what everyone says, it sounds like these are always fun nights.

Replies.Author: Gene
Replies.Content:
God I know Shinryaku is bad. I should’ve just forced Ore no etc. upon you all. ‘Specially since ep 3 is amazing.

Dead Leaves is on the hard drive, ‘case anyone wants it. In fact, Dead Leaves is almost exactly like PSG, except its by IG Prod.

PSG is probably going straight to Adult Swim; place bets now as to when that’ll be.

Replies.Content:

Replies.Author: Grant Walker
Replies.Content:
It definitely seems like something Adult Swim would snatch right up. It also seems like a show that would be hard to mess up the voices for, though…

Like FLCL. Call me a scrub, but I actually think the english dub for that show is amazing.

Replies.Author: chpark
Replies.Content: I liked Ikamusume. I really like comedies revolving around everyday life. And even though Ikamusume herself is not an everyday life person, but the story involves everyday life events, and I like it. And for the same reason, I like Soredemo Machi wa Mawatteiru.
